caption: A very beautiful museum and library in Paris. I would say THE BEST. They have manuscripts from several regions over the world. I saw rigveda and Mahabharata for the first time in my Life in this museum. They also display a lot of French culture. It also has a really beautiful library. A must visit when in Paris.

The Museum of the Bibliothèque de France (Library of France) covers humanity and culture. So precious objects that tell the story of humanity's evolution are here. The reading room is equally as impressive: arts and culture are covered as well as a great section for kids.
Go it is free and not too crowded If you like medals ,the artwork of it and some Olympic memorabilia pertaining to Olympians from France this is a great spot to educate about the history

A phenomenal little museum in a beautiful library! I'm not usually an antiquities person but their collection is magnificent. The interactive displays were so well done that it actually made me interested in red-figure pottery! The temporary exhibit on revolutions in Paris was a master class in museum design and very informative as an American whose knowledge of French history begins and ends in the 1790s. In addition to its collections, the library is full of wonderful architecture from the 17th through 21st centuries; I stared at the mythology frescoes on the ceiling of the Mazarin Gallery for a good 20 minutes.  Not a "must-see" like the Louvre or Musée d'Orsay, but if you're a museum nerd like me, you'll have a great time. Plus it's free if you're under 26!

I've been there by coincidence. If you're under 26 and live in Europe you can enter for free apparently. As for the exhibitions they're good and worth taking a look at. They have a huge library that looks so impressive.
I always wanted to go there... and that didnt disappoint! Building is amazing, the rooms are stunning, not to mention the different collections they have. Staff was extremely nice too.
Outstanding collection of antiquities and manuscripts in an amazing building. Quiet and uncrowded experience. Very chic neighborhood of Palais Royal. A must see in Paris
Really worth a visit. Especially a guided visit with Maelys Robin. We loved her energy and passion!
Nice to visit, though signage not in English.
Beautiful refurnished main reading room. However, unfortunately the other room which was open to visits in the past, was closed. The stairs are also stunning.

As far as i am concerned pass on the museum unless you have a special interest on old coins and vases. Aim towards the oval room which is free and incredibly beautiful. Grab a book and stay there the rest of the day. IMO.
The museum is good, and the oval room is quite impressive. I do not recommend trying to get to the museum if you're paying full price.
Show stopping installation. Building and grounds are beautiful. Staff very friendly
Nice museum with a Gutenberg Bible, Grand Cameo de France and other interesting books and small objects. The reading rooms are really beautiful too
Free entry and perfect atmosphere 👑
Simply beautiful
Beautiful 💯
Great
Unmissable
Must see place)

Pleasant surprise this place. A little gem in Paris. They have a large collection of works and art. The library area is free and the museum costs $10 euros. There are not so many people so you can enjoy them pleasantly. I hope you can meet him.
Very nice. The rooms are magnificent, particularly the Oval room with free access. Leafing through the Gutemberg Bible was particularly pleasant…
A magical experience. Small but rich museum, and above all lively, full of busy researchers on the relics of the past. If this museum is so beautiful, it is also because we know it is loved.

Little known but very interesting museum. The building has been restored from top to bottom and has become accessible to everyone. Elevators, reading room toilets. The entrance fee to the Museum is 10€

This is a museum located in the National Library of France that opened in 2023. There are valuable exhibits from a wide range of eras, including not only France, but also Egypt and ancient Rome, which is very interesting. The furniture is very nice, and you can enjoy the atmosphere of visiting a small castle. A full-length portrait of Louis XIV was also on display. There were valuable items on display, including paintings depicting the Bastille, where the French Revolution began, and handwritten musical scores by Mozart and Beethoven. It's located right between the Opera Garnier and the Louvre Museum, so it's easy to access, and it's a good size, so we recommend it.
Very impressive historic building!  Not that busy despite my visit on a Saturday afternoon which is nice.
Superb establishment!!! It's simply magnificent!! We visited it during heritage days.
An interesting museum with exceptional exhibits from different times and countries. Entrance fee, but worth the visit.
Large and beautiful library.  Upstairs museum with valuable pieces
Great place rich in diverse and varied collections. The reading rooms are sublime. To do absolutely.
Very nice discovery, too bad one of the galleries was closed but it will be an opportunity to come back! Impressive to see all these ancient pieces and yet so well preserved

More than the museum, the trip is especially true for the entire site. The collections are beautiful and interesting but above all well presented. A beautiful walk and we discover that the oval reading room is freely accessible.
Very beautiful museum, favorite for the library. To access certain rooms you must be a card holder.  @Angy_photographe

The site is worth the detour!! The oval room of the library is magnificent and worth stopping there! The museum exhibits a collection of coins, medals, vases... really very pretty, in impeccable condition 🤩👌 …

The Museum of Artefacts ~  Great place, the staff is attentive. Easy access for people with reduced mobility.  The strength of this establishment undoubtedly lies in the diversity that emanates from its collection, revealing large maps, rare works, dazzling jewels, Athenian ceramics, majestic paintings... So many treasures that amaze with their splendor and the history that runs through them.
Magnificent restoration! Very beautiful garden Peaceful place for a moment of relaxation
A very pleasant museum to visit with several very interesting themes. The tour instructions are very well done and attract our curiosity. Highly recommended.

A superb museum housing rich and exceptional collections. An authentic place with a very pleasant museum. The oval room constitutes the setting of this magnificent museum. A heritage site that you absolutely must visit!
